title: What can hide a gold from metal detector at the border? - Quora

response.answer_text: lead. If Gold was encased within lead box, it would not be detected as Gold by a modern metal detector device. But the lead would be picked up which might be a concern. Another curious way of bypassing customs and their detectors- wear the gold as a cross or large chain- they ask you to take it off and give it back shortly afterwards

Gold is not a material that is considered as hazardous. So, why not ship/mail it across the boarder, depending on how much it is? If a lot, then label it as lead, The metal detector will not determine it is gold only that it is metal, in all likelihood, so the shipper should have no problem getting it past customs.
